This plant is characterized by its elongated leaves and distinctive floral structures, which are typical of the genus Steironema. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant or in specialized botanical gardens.
